page.title: 20HARVEY'S - A WORKING MUSEUM
page.content: The group who surveyed this block found their visit to Mr Harvey's Saw- and Scutch- Mills in Kilwaughter, the most interesting of all. They found, hidden away in a country lane, historical workshops, still being operated by a man whose grandfather and father had done the same work - a man with skill in his hands, and a deep desire to preserve what could be regarded as a Working Museum. Many governments would support such devot- ion, and we think that Mr Harvey deserves to be sponsored and assisted in maintaining a building and work of great Historical Interest. This survey has greatly helped the pupils of Primary 7, Larne & Inver Primary School, 1984-5, in better understanding the locality where they live, the history of their families, and why life is as it now is, here!
